data.definition: the part of the body below the chest that contains the stomach, bowels, etc.
data.sentence: He was knocked over by a flying tennis ball that hit his abdomen at full speed.

data.definition: to take somebody away illegally, especially by using force.
data.sentence: He had attempted to abduct the two children.

data.definition: to put an end to.
data.sentence: The movement to abolish unreasonable taxes was successful.

data.definition: to shorten (a book, speech, or a film) without loosing the sense.
data.sentence: To abridge a book is a way of reducing its size.

data.definition: reverse to the previous position.
data.sentence: We were forced to backtrack and find our way around the park.

data.definition: a type of very small organism that lives in air, earth, water, plants and animals, often one which causes a disease.
data.sentence: The bacterium `Streptococcus pneumoniae' causes about a third of some 3000 annual meningitis cases.

data.definition: with scalp wholly or partly hairless.
data.sentence: At twenty he was already going bald.

data.definition: a violent robber or outlaw belonging to a gang.
data.sentence: The masked bandit was almost beaten to death by numerous passers-by.

data.definition: the transmission capacity of a computer network.
data.sentence: We are working towards expanding the bandwidth for this building.

data.definition: barrier erected to oppose movement.
data.sentence: The police barricade forced traffic to a standstill.

data.definition: a lawyer who has the right to argue cases in the higher courts of law.
data.sentence: His uncle is one of the best barrister in town.

data.definition: a self-service restaurant.
data.sentence: She carried her tray to the counter in the cafeteria to get her food.

data.definition: a substance found in coffee and tea that makes you feel more active.
data.sentence: A cup of coffee raises your levels of caffeine in the blood.

data.definition: to use numbers to find out a total number, amount, distance, etc.

data.definition: the action or process of calibrating something.
data.sentence: The measuring devices require calibration before usage.

data.definition: grey or white with darker round marks.
data.sentence: The clouds threw dapples of shadow over the eerily quiet street.

data.definition: the first appearance of light in the sky before sunrise.

data.definition: able to cause death.
data.sentence: This is quite a deadly poison which will cause death almost immediately after consumption.

data.definition: a lack of something; the fact of there not being enough of something.
data.sentence: There was a dearth of usable firewood at the campsite.

data.definition: never dying or forgotten.
data.sentence: Shahin an author who craved deathless fame.

data.definition: producing a desired or intended result .
data.sentence: Our instructions were effective and helped the students.

data.definition: thinking only of oneself, without regard for the feelings or desires of others .
data.sentence: I never met a more egocentric person.

data.definition: being excessively proud of oneself.
data.sentence: His boss is an egotistic man who everyone dislikes.

data.definition: area sealed off by a barricade.
data.sentence: The animals were all herded together inside the enclosure.

data.definition: very large in size, quantity, or extent.
data.sentence: She travelled to New York because the city offered enormous possibilities to young fashion designers.

data.definition: improve the quality or value of.
data.sentence: You can enrich your vocabulary by reading more often.

data.definition: a lack of food during a long period of time in a region.

data.definition: reduced to extreme hunger.

data.definition: a state of not happening or being used at present.

data.definition: very repugnant; hateful.
data.sentence: The offense done by him is abhorrent.

data.definition: the act of not allowing yourself to have something that you want; the act of rejecting something.

data.definition: said by someone who is performing a magic trick, in order to help them perform it successfully.
data.sentence: I don’t know all the theoretical abracadabra about how it works

data.definition: a swollen within body tissue.

data.definition: (of mathematics) the distance from a point on a graph to the vertical or y-axis; the x-coordinate.
data.sentence: He did all the calculations properly, but inserted the wrong value of the abscissa.

data.definition: a group of people or a system that protects a way of life or a belief when it seems that it may disappear.

data.definition: an utter failure.

data.definition: having characteristics regarded as typical of a woman; unmanly.

data.definition: vivacious and enthusiastic.
data.sentence: They wanted a team of effervescent young people.

data.definition: based on, or holding, the belief that everyone is equal and should have the same rights and opportunities.
data.sentence: He described himself as ‘an egalitarian’ and believed his wife has the same rights as he does.

data.definition: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
data.sentence: She made an eloquent speech.

data.definition: fixed firmly into something.

data.definition: a very deep wide space or hole that seems to have no bottom.

data.definition: make more noticeable or prominent.

data.definition: a piece of music to be played slowly.

data.definition: impossible to persuade, or unwilling to change an opinion or decision.
data.sentence: I've told her she should stay at home and rest but she's adamant that she's coming.

data.definition: one's area of interest or operation.
